isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - Specifications - Welding

svcprocinfo.para: To provide a commercial quality weld for truck applications, the following welding information should be followed for welding transverse torque rods to rear axle housings.

svcsubproc.title: Welder Certification
svcsubproc.para: All welding on axle housings must be done by welders certified by an independent testing laboratory to meet the requirements of AWS D1.1 Structural Welding Code.

svcsubproc.title: Surface Preparation
svcsubproc.para: Weld joints must be free from contamination, such as moisture, lubricants and rust. Paint must be removed since it will adversely affect the weld quality.

svcsubproc.title: Weld Joint Fit-up
svcsubproc.para: A slight grind to fit condition may exist between the housing and bracket due to axle housing and bracket tolerances. Grind the bracket to fit ( Figure 198). The bracket should fit-up as close as possible to avoid excessive welding.

svcsubproc.title: Weld Lengths
svcsubproc.para: The effective weld length shall not include skips, off location welds and/or other conditions defined in Weld Quality.

svcsubproc.title: Weld Location
svcsubproc.para: All welds should be centered laterally in the joint in a manner to insure fusion between the parts being joined. Portions of the weld which are undersize, or do not meet the minimum requirements for weld quality (undercut, porosity, craters) shall be considered as skips and are not considered in the weld length.

svcsubproc.title: Weld Leg Size
svcsubproc.para: The minimum weld leg has to be at least as thick as the minimum thickness of the thinnest member of the bracket.

svcsubproc.title: Throat Thickness
svcsubproc.para: The minimum throat thickness of fillet welds are to be equal to 60% of the shortest weld leg size. Maximum throat thickness is to be limited to 100% of the longest leg size ( Figure 199).

svcsubproc.title: Definitions
svcsubproc.para: The welding terms shall be interpreted in accordance with the definitions given in AWS - Weld (ANSI/AWS A2.4 latest issue).

svcsubproc.title: Symbols
svcsubproc.para: Welding symbols shall be interpreted in accordance with AWS Standard Welding Symbols (ANSI/AWS A2.4 latest issue).

svcsubproc.title: Weld Quality
svcsubproc.para: Unless otherwise specified, the following characteristics shall be permitted. No more than one of these characteristics shall be permitted in the weld if any other characteristic is at the maximum limit.
Undercut: Shall not exceed .030 inch (0.8 mm).

Craters: Unfilled craters are not considered part of the effective weld length, and are therefore limited by the length of the weld tolerance for gaps. They can be properly filled and counted in the weld length.
Cracks and Burn-Through: Cracks in the weld and holes burned through the base stock will not be permitted.
Visible Porosity - Frequency: No more than four (4) significant pores shall be permitted in any 1 inch (25mm) of weld length with the average limited to one (1) per 1 inch (25mm) of weld length.

Visible Porosity - Severity: The maximum diameter of the pores shall be 1/16 inch (1.6 mm) and shall be spaced at least 1/16 inch (1.6 mm) apart. Pores must be larger than 1/64 inch (0.4 mm) in diameter to be considered significant. Porosity shall not be permitted in any weld specified as oil tight.
Inclusions: Non-metallic inclusions shall be considered and judged as a gap.

svcsubproc.title: Welding Recommendations
svcsubproc.para: The welding rod used shall produce a minimum tensile strength of 70,000 psi using an all-weld-metal test sample tested in accordance with AWS B4.0. Typical processes and electrodes which meet this requirement are as follows:

entry.para: 1. Shielded metal-arc welding of carbon low alloy steels.
2. Gas metal-arc welding of carbon and low alloy steels.
3. Submerged arc welding of mild and low alloy steels.

svcsubproc.para: Use the voltage and amperage recommended by the electrode manufacturer. This will provide the best fusion and strongest weld.

Do not "test the arc" on the housing. Deposit the required amount of metal with the least number of passes - one pass is preferred. Where a second pass is required, thoroughly remove the slag from the weld between passes.

On brackets that require welding all around, distortion and stress can be further controlled by welding on opposite sides of the bracket alternately. Figure 200 shows the tack welding sequence. Tack welds must be cleaned prior to final welding.

Figure 201 shows the sequence and direction of the final weld. Start weld at each end of bracket and work toward middle of bracket. Remove the slag from the weld. Cover the tack welds with the final welds.

figure.caption: Figure 201. Final Weld Sequence and Direction

svcsubproc.para: There is a notch in the end of the transverse torque rod bracket for use as a moisture drain. Do not weld in the area of the notch ( Figure 202).

figure.caption: Figure 202. Do Not Weld in Area of This Notch

svcsubproc.para: If information on welding locations of transverse rods is required, call 1-800-44TRUCK.
